title: Pensioner takes compensation battle with broker to streets of London

Mon, Oct 12, 2015, 11:56 BST - UK Markets close in 4 hrs 34 mins Pensioner takes compensation battle with broker to streets of London By Richard Evans | Telegraph – 29 minutes ago 0.00 0.00 
This investor lost about half a million pounds as a result of his stockbroker's choices but has received only £150,000 in redress 
A pensioner who lost about £500,000 when his stockbroker made a series of disastrous investments on his behalf has taken his fight for full compensation to the firm’s offices in the City of London (LSE: CIN.L - news ) . 
So far James Bagot and his wife, Delia, have received just £150,000 plus interest after they took their case against WH Ireland (LSE: WHI.L - news ) to the financial ombudsman, While the adjudicator recommended that the broker pay full recompense, it has the power to order only a maximum of £150,000. 
Mr Bagot, of Buckhurst Hill in Essex, protested outside WH Ireland’s offices for several hours on Thursday and said he received countless expressions of support from passers-by. 
• What we can learn from the broker that lost his client £500,000 
“It (Other OTC: ITGL - news ) was actually quite a nice day out,” he said. “People were coming up to me all day long and wishing me good luck. 
“No one from the company came down to talk to me, although they must have called the police two officers went into the offices and then came out and spoke to me. 
“When I reassured them that it was just me and my friend and a static protest, they said 'no problem, carry on’.” 
Mr Bagot added: “I aim to be back next week I think they are rattled.” 
He said he planned to amend his placard, however, after it was pointed out that one of the WH Ireland employees named, Miles Nolan, the firm’s head of communications, was not a director. 
The firm described the contents of the placard as “factually inaccurate” and threatened to take legal action against Telegraph Money if it reported them.
